topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c596d6368721a0ed40100#post_545c596d6368721a0ed40100
That's sort of how the American Revloution happened. British Empire said "pay taxes." Colonists said "We don't wanna." Britain says "we'll spank you if you don't." Colonist called their bluff by dumping a bunch of tea in the harbor dressed as Native Americans [spoiler]hurrah for casual racism[/spoiler]. England says "time for a right proper spanking." Unfortunately they were too busy spanking the French and Spanish to deal with colonists.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
actually here are the details of canadian independence summarized

"Timeline":http://www.jjmccullough.com/timeline.htm
Dec 11, 1931- Statute of Westminster / Founding of "Commonwealth":
-British Parliament can no longer make laws for Canada.
-Canada can modify or repeal past British-made legislation
-Canada has right to it's own foreign policy.
-Virtual political independence from Britain

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c5a9c636872769a140100#post_545c5a9c636872769a140100

Yep, autonomous.
Virtual political independence translates into "You can make your own laws and regulations but some aspects will still be handled by the British government."


"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/545c5a6063687244eb6e0000#post_545c5a6063687244eb6e0000

Add to the fact that there was (and still isn't) no security that the taxes people were paying at the time were being invested properly. If you see pics of how Boston and New York looked... Yeah
